meanings.definition: Cautiously or carefully considering all possible consequences before taking action.
meanings.sent1: She walked circumspectly through the dark alley, wary of any potential danger.
meanings.sent2: He always drives circumspectly, making sure to follow all traffic rules.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel circumspectly eyed the acorns, trying to decide which one to take first.
meanings.sent4: The detective circumspectly examined the crime scene, looking for any clues.
meanings.sent5: The student circumspectly reviewed each answer before submitting the test.

meanings.definition: In a watchful and discreet manner.
meanings.sent1: The security guard patrolled the premises circumspectly, keeping an eye out for any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent2: She observed the meeting circumspectly from a distance, not wanting to draw attention to herself.
meanings.sent3: The cat circumspectly approached the sleeping dog, trying not to wake it up.
meanings.sent4: The spy circumspectly gathered information without raising any suspicion.
meanings.sent5: The owl circumspectly watched its prey before swooping in for the catch.
